thread.section_title: Business & Financial News, U.S & International Breaking News | Reuters
thread.title: GE merges transportation unit with Wabtec in $11.1 billion deal

author: Reuters Editorial
title: GE merges transportation unit with Wabtec in $11.1 billion deal
text:
May 21, 2018 / 11:27 AM / in 13 minutes GE merges transportation unit with Wabtec in $11.1 billion deal Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
(Reuters) - General Electric Co ( GE.N ) confirmed on Monday it will merge its transportation business that makes train engines with Wabtec Corp ( WAB.N ), a U.S. manufacturer of equipment for the rail industry, in a deal valued at about $11.1 billion. FILE PHOTO: The logo of General Electric is seen at its plant in Baden, Switzerland November 15, 2017. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo
GE and its shareholders will own 50.1 percent of the combined company, while Wabtec shareholders will own the rest, the companies said in a statement.
Reuters reported on Sunday that a deal valuing the combined business at more than $20 billion could be announced this week. Reporting by Rachit Vats in Bengaluru; editing by Patrick Graham
